data.title: Linnemann Funeral Homes
data.meta_description: Let Linnemann Funeral Homes ease the pain of your suffering. Call our funeral home today in Boone County for more info about our services. (859) 727-1250
data.text:
Terence “Terry” A. Nyquist, 65, passed away peacefully on Friday, August 9, 2024, at Boonespring in Union, KY. He was a graduate of the University of North Dakota. With a career spanning over 40 years, Terry began his journey as an airline pilot with Comair, later flew with US Air, and ultimately retired from American…

View More

Mary Elizabeth McIntosh (nee, Smith), 79, of Florence, KY, passed away peacefully on Thursday, August 8, 2024, at St. Elizabeth Healthcare in Florence. Mary was a dedicated homemaker who devoted over 60 years to caring for children, leaving a lasting impact on many lives. She found joy in watching her favorite soap operas and was…

View More

Urszula Barczak was more than a mom, sister, grandma, great grandma, aunt, friend and nurse; she was a child of God who lived her faith in all she did. She was a living example of how to be Christ to one another. She dedicated her life to her family and to nursing, literally keeping her…

View More

Joan Schmidt (née Hoffer), beloved mother, grandmother, and cherished educator, passed away on Monday, August 5, 2024, at St. Elizabeth in Florence, KY. Joan was a dedicated and passionate primary school teacher in the Erlanger/Elsmere school district, where she touched countless young lives and was everyone’s favorite teacher. A lifelong parishioner of St. Henry Catholic…

View More

Agnes M. Davidson “Sis”, 92, passed away Friday August 2, 2024 surrounded by her loving family. She was a homemaker and a member of St Joseph Church in Crescent Springs KY. Preceded in death by her husband Vernon Davidson. Survivors include her daughter JoAnn Dirkes, daughter Joyce (Paul) Creech, Son Steve (Sherree Hale) Davidson, daughter…

View More

Frank Lueke, 63 of Ft. Mitchell, passed away on August 2, 2024, after a courageous battle with cancer. Frank found joy in the simple pleasures of life. He was an avid enthusiast of working on cars, taking immense satisfaction in every project he undertook. His love for the outdoors was evident in his passion for…

View More

Mark David Thacker, 62, of Highland Heights, KY passed away on Monday, July 29, 2024 at his residence. Mark was a graduate of Campbell County High School and he worked in custodial services at Northern Kentucky University. Mark was a kind-hearted son and brother who often thought of others. He enjoyed taking walks, chatting with…

View More

Pamela Rice, 78, of Dry Ridge, KY, passed away peacefully on July 29, 2024. She was the daughter of the late Robert and Mayme Eades on May 6, 1946 in Covington, Kentucky. She is preceded in death by her mother in law, Mildred Hegge-Rice, father in law, James Robert Rice Jr., and her daughter in…

View More

Carl W. Meyer, 82 of Sarasota, passed away on Sunday July 28, 2024 at Tidwell Hospice House surrounded by his beloved family. Carl was born on April 22, 1942 to the late Carl and Helen Meyer. Carl was a devout Catholic, beloved parishioner at St. Patrick Church in Sarasota, FL and formerly at St. Pius…

View More

Kendall, John William, 91, of Burlington, KY died July 27, 2024 at Woodcrest Nursing Home. Born August 1,1932 in Huntington, West Virginia, John lived the biggest part of his life in Boone County. He was an active member and volunteer of Burlington Baptist Church for the past 29 years where he enjoyed greeting and most…

View More

David Neal Snow, 77, of Cincinnati, OH, passed away peacefully on Friday, July 26, 2024, at Ivy Woods Healthcare Center. Born on October 16, 1946, David lived a life marked by service, joy, and creativity. David proudly served his country in the US Army, a testament to his dedication and sense of duty. Following his…

View More

Father Bernard Colussy, OFM, the long-time pastor of Our Lady of the Rosary Roman Catholic Church in Waubeka, Wisconsin, passed away early in the morning on July 24, 2024. He was born on December 25, 1939, in Bridgeville, Pennsylvania and had a great devotion to the Catholic Faith. After graduating from high school, he earned a…

View More

FLENNIKEN, Roy Joseph, 70, of Lakeside Park, KY, passed away July 22, 2024 at home. Born in Covington, KY on June 4, 1954 he was a 4th degree Knight of Columbus, was known as a Kentucky Colonel and enjoyed traveling, hiking in the National Parks and especially loved his sports teams; UK basketball and the…

View More

David Brian Crowell, 76, of Erlanger, KY, passed away on Monday, July 22, 2024, at St. Elizabeth Healthcare in Edgewood, KY. He was born on July 8, 1948, to the late James and Ann Crowell. David proudly served his country as a veteran of the United States Marine Corps. David had a passion for golf,…

View More

Sylvia “Syl” Marlene Hartke (nee Rose), 84, of Villa Hills, KY, passed away peacefully surrounded by her family, on Saturday, July 20, 2024, at Rosedale Green. Sylvia was a business woman who helped grow their Servpro franchises with her husband, Wayne, for over 34 years. She was a devout Catholic. She loved spending her winters…

View More
